title: Unspecified Error
body: It started to download a patch this morning, was playing just fine last night.  " Unspecified error occurred. Please check logs for more information." I've already deleted the lol_air_client to restart patch and it just does it again after downloading it.

replies.body: I'd like to help with this but need some more info!  This error can mean different things depending on when it's happening.  At what percent are you experiencing the unspecified error?  Would you happen to have a screenshot for context?  Looking forward to helping out!

Well intially it was the good'ol 33% , now it says it at the "calculating difference| XXX files scanned" random number each time and it still says 33%. Restarts the scan each time I click 'Retry" 

http://i64.tinypic.com/2uf3kih.png

Similarly to Final Spark Lux's issue, your network might be having trouble establishing a connection to our patching server.  Go over our [connection issues ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)guide to help get you back on track.  Hopefully, these steps will have you patched and ready to play!

I did the easiest thing first before getting involved with anything; restarting my computer did the trick. I suggest other people try that. Not to say that it's a guaranteed fix for everybody, but it did work for me, so it may work for some others as well.
Yes very odd, that worked for me as well. lol

I'm having the same problem. Also I have no idea how to post pictures on these boards lol. I wasn't having any problems with the client yesterday, so I'm assuming it's from something that happened today. http://i64.tinypic.com/2gwdws3.png

At 33%, your patcher is attempting to download files but can't maintain a connection.  There may be an issue with your network establishing this download, and I recommend going over our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to fix this up.  Let me know how this works out for you!

Tracing route to 192.64.174.65 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  192.168.0.1
  2     5 ms     3 ms     3 ms  tukw-dsl-gw67.tukw.qwest.net [63.231.10.67]

I'm reading another post about login issues for people qith centurylink/qwest internet. Could that be the problem for me as well?
